definition: to form pairs/to be in couples
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: It is not every couple that is a pair.
sentences.chinese: 成雙成對多，珠聯璧合少。

sentences.english: The party was full of couples, with no single people.
sentences.chinese: 參加晚會的人全都成雙成對，沒有單身的。

sentences.english: They come at least in pairs, one serving as substratum for the other.
sentences.chinese: 他們至少都是成雙成對，互爲對方的次階層。

sentences.english: Evenings bring couples and singles for concert.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚引得成雙成對和單身的男女去聽音樂會。

sentences.english: People see on the streets in pairs, but can only head down to walk.
sentences.chinese: 街上看到別人成雙成對，卻只能低着頭走路。
客人們成雙成對地來了。

sentences.english: As the couples closed upon him he expressed his congratulations .
sentences.chinese: 當那些成雙成對的人走近他時，他向他們表示了祝賀。

sentences.english: Rabid mutualism doesn't just happen in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 狂熱的互利共生並非只能成雙成對。

sentences.english: Like hydrogen and oxygen, for some couples, opposites attract.
sentences.chinese: 就像氫和氧，有些人成雙成對的緣故是因爲異性相吸。

sentences.english: One by one the lovers drifted off into the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 情人們成雙成對地在月光下漫步。

sentences.english: The rings are always in pair, But weared in two separate ring finger.
sentences.chinese: 婚戒雖成雙成對，卻都戴在兩個單獨的無名指上。

sentences.english: They wexclusivedered off in pairs exclusived chatted concerning their own events.
sentences.chinese: 他們成雙成對結伴而行，聊着家常大事。

sentences.english: In the zoo pond, the mandarin ducks are swimming in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 動物園的池塘裏，鴛鴦正在成雙成對地戲水。

sentences.english: After dinner the boys and girls paired off and went to dance.
sentences.chinese: 會餐後，男女青年們成雙成對地去跳舞。

sentences.english: These lions usually come in pairs, with the male on the right and female on the left.
sentences.chinese: 這些石獅子大多成雙成對，公的在右，母的在左。

definition: full of tender feelings (idiom); tender-hearted
depressed/cheerless
unswerving in one's loyalty (idiom); faithful and constant
(literary) to smile
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lonely soul/solitary
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
dejected/disheartened/listless
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
